fields.description: в таблицу отчетов сбрасывается столько раз запись по предприятию, сколько раз я заходила и корректировала данные (например по уточненке)
fields.summary: таблица отчетов

fields.description: Allowing anonymous to create bugs breaks the feedback loop. I can't ask for more information.
fields.summary: I should be able to disable Anonymous access to creating issues

fields.description:
Each file in the Downloads tab should have a description. This should be quite a basic thing.

There are just some things that should be in the description rather than having an overly-long filename that describes the download.
fields.summary: add a "description" field for Downloads

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I suggest adding some extra information to folder list, as you do to file listing.

A nice thing to see when looking at a list of folders would be time of the latest update of the more recent file on that folder. Github does it and I think it is really useful.

Cheers!

ivan (SYD office)
fields.summary: Extra information for folders

fields.description:
If I trying to create Issue with URL:\\
http://hg.our-army.su/ha-mission/issues/new\\
I get 404 Error when press "Create Issue" button.

But if I trying to do the same with not custom URL:\\
https://bitbucket.org/OurArmy/ha-mission/issues/new\\
All is ok.
fields.summary: 404 Error if I try create Issue from custom domain URL

fields.description: Currently, if a commit or a pull request contains too much data to pull from disk and display, Bitbucket may fail to render the page entirely resulting in a 500 error. There should be either a more graceful way to fail, showing some information or at least a more descriptive error allowing users to understand what has happened with a workaround.
fields.summary: Fail more gracefully when a commit or Pull request cannot be rendered (BB-6393)

fields.description:
If you create an issue and title it follow, the slug that is created collides with the action follow which is to follow an issue. All actions should have a way to work around them so that issues can be named appropriately.

This can be especially tricky for users using Unicode characters in their names, as the slug generation isn't compatible with them and strips all the unknown characters off, sometimes leaving only a single action word.
fields.summary: Issue action URLs are colliding with issue name slugs (BB-6402)

fields.description:
Hi

I'm not sure this is a bug or not, I see that one file in my downloads area got around 120 downloads in a few days, and it seems they went from 4-5 to that number over just one day. That sounds strange to me, could it be a problem in the counter or can you confirm that that's a real and correct number (it would really be a surprising number)?

https://bitbucket.org/wasp/elmahr/downloads

Thanks

Wasp
fields.summary: Number of downloads seems wrong (BB-6492)

fields.description:
Similar to the SVN checkin hooks in FishEye/Crucible, I would like to see the ability to add tagged comments in Mercurial or Git and have bitbucket parse on push and create file-based code reviews.

This is a very key feature which Atlassian OnDemand will no longer support once OnDemand FishEye/Crucible is gone. To support customers using that feature and expand the capabilities of Bitbucket I would like to see it appear in the next year. I don't mind it being a paid add-on either, but would really like it supported.
fields.summary: Trigger file-based code reviews from checkin comments (BB-6500)

fields.description:
Apparently it's not possible to load the list of branches and tags if the repository is opened under a custom URL. As long as the URL contains the bitbucket.org URL, everything works fine. If it's something else, it doesn't work.

For instance try to open the branches and tags list on the source tab for the following repositories:

* http://hg.secondlife.com/viewer-development -> Doesn't work
* https://bitbucket.org/lindenlab/viewer-development -> Same repo as above, does work

Or another example:

* http://hg.catznip.com/catznip -> Doesn't work
* https://bitbucket.org/Kitty_Barnett/catznip -> Same repo as above, does work
fields.summary: "Could not load branches and tags" reloaded (#5071)

fields.description: Hi, I supose, adding custom avatars would be a great idea, bacause there are some people out there, that don't like using gravatar because of the identity problems.
fields.summary: Feature suggestion: non-gravatar avatars

fields.description: Bitbucket is rendered very... VERY wrong in IE10 (both metro and desktop versions)
fields.summary: Wrong rendering on IE10

fields.description:
Dear developers,

Thank you for a good product and promising enhancements that you roll out regularly.

I'd like to suggest to add AJAX issue management functionality to the "issue list" view.

h2. Problem description
Being a project manager, I have to go into each issue, change it's state, priority, milestone, then save. Then review the list and do same actions with each issue separately.

h2. Proposal
It would be way more convenient to change priorities, states and other properties right from the "isse list" view.

*Examples:*\\
Click "arrow up" (major priority), an AJAX popup appears, I change the state to "Minor".\\
Click status "NEW", AJAX popup appears, I change it's state to "On hold".

etc.
fields.summary: Working with issue list through AJAX: changing states, importance, etc.

fields.description: I'm trying to set the "language" and "logo" for a project via the API. The HTTP response indicates success, but only the language gets changed.
fields.summary: REST API doesn't seem to allow changing project logos (BB-6403)
Embedding external images in README.md (BB-6489)

fields.description: I would like to use a . in usernames. Why is this not possible?
fields.summary: Allow . in usernames

fields.description: Topic should say enough
fields.summary: Issues created via API are not visible in Dashboard nor repository's Recent Activity

fields.description:
You can't add a decent length stack trace to an issue without it crashing on save. When I first started using BB this wasn't a problem, I never hit a limit. Then there was a revision where validation was added to the field such that you had to cut it down before saving. This was worse but it still worked. Currently, it lets you put in whatever you like but crashes when you try to save. You get an error if you try to go back into it, so you end up with a zombie issue.

Here is an example error code: d33819139f964fbdacbc655450ec8782$68ab6e43db54e93e03c18e611f542246
fields.summary: Issue Description field length restriction is miserly

fields.description:
@hsu

We've seen a problem a few times today where we try to create a pull request and it just hangs there.  Specifically, the "Create pull request" button is grayed out and the little busy spinner is spinning, but nothing ever happens, after a very long wait.

The first time it happened, we merged the change manually.

The second time, I merged from the "main" branch that I had branched from and was requesting to pull back to, then tried again to create the pull request and it succeeded.  In the meantime there had been some changes on the "main" branch.

Now I'm on the third time and I don't know what to do.  There aren't any new changes on the "main" branch to merge in.  So I'm stuck.

I'm making the priority critical because pull requests have become a major part of our workflow.  They're awesome!  But only when they're working...

In particular, at this moment I'm trying to create a pull request from osrf/gazebo/issue_138 to osrf/gazebo/dev.
fields.summary: Create pull request hangs (sometimes) (BB-6399)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I have a work and personal accounts for which I prefer to use one public key for all my SSH access. I have registered a new username and tried to import my public key I use for work account (different username) and got an error "Someone has already registered that SSH key.". Is there a way around this because I won't be using the service if I need a different private/public for every username I work under.

Thanks\\
Boris
fields.summary: Someone has already registered that SSH key.

fields.description:
Hi guys. I try to create repositories but the load never stop. See in my account.

Tanks.
fields.summary: Infinite load Creating Repository

fields.description: I am not able to create repository. the BitBucket waits indefinitely
fields.summary: Not able to create repository

fields.description:
While viewing source code the fonts are ugly:\\
https://dl.dropbox.com/u/25202446/ugly.png

As a matter of fact this message I'm typing looks just ugly as the fonts in the screenshot.

Contrary, when I'm viewing source code _diffs_ the fonts look awesome.

Please fix it :) The new interface is so beautiful, so the contrast with the ugly fonts is killing me!

Thanks!
fields.summary: Ugly linux font while viewing source code (BB-6401)

fields.description:
Right now, the content of SQL files is not displayed in diffs because they are treated as binary files. It would be extremely helpful to be able to view the content of these files.

In our case, these files are often used by bamboo to update the schema of the database after the pull request is accepted. Not being able to view the contents makes it very difficult to know if the request should be improved.
fields.summary: SQL files should be viewable instead of being treated as binary

fields.description: See attached - when you'll have bigger number of branches active then some of them are not visible in left side graph
fields.summary: Graph not visible when more branches are in use

fields.description: My friends and I started a company together and each owned a few repos. We transferred ownership of those repos to a team account. However, now that the team account owns them we cannot remove the creator under "Access management". Does being "creator" confer you any read or write permissions? If any of us were to leave the company, then the company should be able to remove us from the repos.
fields.summary: Repos transferred to a team retain creator status (and admin privs) (BB-6427)

fields.description:
I forked a private repo from my corporation into a private repo of my ownership and started developing.

Later when i finished developing I created a pull request for the changes, but as people from my corporation does not have access to my private repo, they cannot see the pull request contents.

As i see, put in one line: if a pull request is created for a repo, the pull request should be always visible for the owner(s) of this repo, regardless of access control rules in the forked repo
fields.summary: Team members cannot see Pull request commits from forks where they do not have permission (BB-6384)

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/src+Resources

A support for it would be much appreciated.

fields.description:
Hello

I created and added a google analytics key that I added on my repository but it's not working. It's been several hours since I added the key to bitbucket but Analytics is still reporting as "Tracking not installed".

I can't find any information in bitbucket docs about what you need to do other than adding the id to repo settings.

fields.description:
Why the **** should I be able to accidentally revoke my own access to a repository that I am admin on?

Your access on nextimageadmin/nim3_core has been revoked.

I need this restored ASAP.
fields.summary: WTF

fields.description:
I am using bitbucket for a couple of years and all that time I was doing some small projects stuff with 2-3 persons.

Bitbucket is getting better and in from my point of view (as a small team member) it could cover all aspects of the project. There are repo, wiki, issues, team management, downloads.

I know that you are trying to keep issues tracker thin and I know that Jira should satisfy all need of advanced project management and project specific stuff. But there are a just very simple things that could make Bitbucket already self contained. I am about some visualisation tools like progress bar to milestone or version. It is not something very complex and it should not be, just small progress bar with configuration what issues are closed for particular milestone or version. At that is all. I believe many people will find that stuff useful.

Before writing that issues I tried to integrate Jira and it was not as perfect as I thought it should be. For example I could not find the way to import issues from Bitbucket to Jira if there were no specific labels in issue names and commits.

Hope there will be some positive feedback or ways to do it with plugins or smth.
fields.summary: issue tracker progressbar

fields.description:
See here:

https://bitbucket.org/pypy/extradoc/raw/eab637f57363ba24a7939f6beca22b54d5b5befc/talk/pyconza2012/talk.rst
fields.summary: default raw encoding is set to ascii (should be UTF8 IMO) (BB-3501)

fields.description:
Instead of individually adding a service (such as 'POST') to each repo, one can set a default one in ones user account. Thus, when on created a new repo, it is added automatically without the user having to think about it.

An extension of this proposal would be to have a central management panel to add and remove services to any number of repos one has control over.
fields.summary: Add a default service to one's account

* Home page shows number of members as 3.
* Team detail page shows number of members as 2.

Kindly refer to the attached doc for the screenshot.
fields.summary: Number of members displayed is inconsistent.

"XMLHttpRequest cannot load https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/xxxxxx/yyyy/branches-tags. Origin https://xxxxx.com is not allowed by Access-Control-Allow-Origin."

BR Valentin

fields.description:
There's a gotcha in the current Wiki design: if the user has a space in the link text, like [[this example]], and then copies and pastes the link text into the page name in the create page dialog, the link does not work. The link is automatically translated to "this_example", and the page name remains untranslated as "this example". While the explanation is easily documented, it is contrary to reasonable expectations.

Recovering from this problem is also difficult, as there's no obvious way to rename a page.

One possible solution would be to do the same translation on page names as is done on link text.
fields.summary: Link and Create Use Different Conventions for Space

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new git repo on bitbucket
# Attempt to push code to it for the first time without cloning it

This fails with the error "fatal: authentication failed" even though I'm pretty sure I'm using the correct password. Following the same steps on github does not produce this error and works as expected, so I'm assuming it is a bitbucket issue.
fields.summary: git push fails on new repos with fatal: authentication failed

fields.description:
through Gmail. I was then forced to create an account complete with an "unconfirmed" email! So what was the use of me using my OpenID to sign in? That is the purpose behind it, so I don't have to give every Tom, Dick, & Harry all my information!. Now you can delete my account and all my information. I only wanted to comment on 1 thing, on 1 page, belonging to someone else who has an account with you. Whoever setup that part of your website needs to go back to the drawing board.\\
I followed the link back to your site for some information during this process & it took me 30 minutes to figure out what I was joining! That is really outrageous!
fields.summary: I signed with my OpenID

fields.description:
I've deleted a repo and would expect that the activity associated with that repo would be removed from the newsfeed.

However, I'm seeing all the old commits listed in my newsfeed.

Is it possible to clear this when deleting a repo, or if it's desired to preserve this in some cases, to add a way to clear the newsfeed?

There seem to be a few issues similar to mine eg issue BCLOUD-2527 , issue BCLOUD-2301

Many thanks,

Chris
fields.summary: Activity from deleted repo shown in newsfeed

fields.description:
Hi. Just noticed that the ascending/descending arrows are back to front. Should point up when list is sorted ascending but currently point down, and vice-versa (see screenshot).

I've done exactly the same thing myself in the past! ;)
fields.summary: Column sort order carets on issues list page are reversed (BB-6397)

fields.description:
# Create a .ps1 (PowerShell) file like so in PS: "get-date" > "date.ps1"
# PS creates a new file with .NET's default encoding
# Push file to BB.

Now BB thinks our date.ps1 file is a binary file. It should detect the encoding and show it as a regular PowerShell file (maybe with a hint at the fact that the encoding isn't ASCII/UTF8).

# On Win, re-encode the date.ps1 file to use UTF8.
# Push again.

Now BB will correctly detect date.ps1 as a PowerShell file.
fields.summary: BB thrown off by UTF16LE byte order mark? (BB-6396)

the $ CI-> load-> _ci_load (......) is now (CI 2.1.3) to access protected. The library "module.php" of ci_modular to call this function directly which causes a bug.

as the bug with CI => 2.0.3 it is necessary to write a method access "PUBLIC"

visit Commits / 4548548\\

cordially\\

fields.description: I have created a linux kernel repository and on the Overview page the README of the linux kernel is shown, which is not very useful. Please consider adding a checkbox in repository admin page so this feature can be enabled/disabled.

fields.description:
In pull requests the following markup

{code}
* item
** subitem
** another subitem
* another item
{code}

gets rendered as

* item *subitem* another subitem
* another item

This happens both in preview and after creating the request. There was a similar issue BCLOUD-2873 for previewing nested lists in issues.
fields.summary: Nested lists not rendered properly in pull requests (BB-6395)

fields.description: My Inbox is usually filled with notifications (_New comment on changeset/issue/..._ or _Pull request #<number> has been..._ etc. Can you provide a filter to show only notifications or only normal messages (sent by a real user)? Finding those real messages from users is really PITA now. :)
fields.summary: Filter messages in inbox

fields.description:
Even as an OSS project, we'd like to be able to define access rights on folder level, in some cases.

Defining folder level access management like gitolite / gitlab defines a flexibility, to protect commit-rights on certain areas that you want only a release manager to handle.

Warm regards\\
Gunther Strube, https://cambridgez88.jira.com
fields.summary: Repository write access management on folder level (BB-6383)

fields.description:
How about adding one click [Resolve] buttons in list of issues?\\
I think issuetracker will become great by adding it.

Thank you.
fields.summary: One click Resolve Button

fields.description:
Currently, logging in on a custom domain doesn't log in on bitbucket or vice versa.

Would be nice to implement a SSO service.
fields.summary: SSO for custom domains. (BB-6394)

fields.description:
As a repo owner I was creating wiki page {{Meetings/2012-10-17.wiki}}.

In the screenshot there is some unclosed tag generated by your wiki before title written by me. The problematic html and wiki page part are highlighted in screenshot.

Desired outcome:\\
There should only be plain text title. There shouldn't be {{20121017">}} text before the title.

Actual outcome:\\
There is an unclosed {{<a>}} tag at the beginning of the wiki page messing up the wiki page text.

I think the part of filename that goes into {{<h1 id='...'>}} (namely the date part {{20121017}}) is considered as a reference to changeset.
fields.summary: Changeset link incorrectly found in wiki page title

fields.description:
hello!

It would be good being able to make some wiki pages of someones repo public.

thx
fields.summary: Wiki page public

fields.description: Jenkins supports building based on a specific branch. Add the ability to fire the Jenkins service only for a specific branch when that branch is committed/pushed to.
fields.summary: Add branch information to Jenkins service (BB-6364)

fields.description:
From a support issue:

bq. I'm having a problem and I 'm not sure if it is a bug or if it is pilot error.


bq. I recently started marking issues 'resolved' by including "Fixed #x" in my commit messages. This marks the issue resolved as expected.\\
However, now any time I push a new branch to bitbucket each issue that was 'auto-marked' previously is auto marked again.\\
Here is the workflow that reproduces this problem:


bq. To summarize:


# Create local branch X
# Push branch X to origin
# Alter branch X locally
# Commit branch X locally with message that includes "Fixed BCLOUD-1" to mark issue 1 resolved.
# Push branch X to origin *** At this point, issue BCLOUD-1 is automatically marked resolved.
# Create and accept pull request to merge branch X with master
# Locally, checkout master and pull from origin
# Create new branch Y.
# Push branch Y to origin *** At this point, issue BCLOUD-1 is commented on again automatically\\
It seems like the "Fixed BCLOUD-1" message is persisting somehow and each time I push a branch, it triggers another round of issue comments and emails. I'm using Git if that matters.
fields.summary: Pushing new branch triggers comments to issues

fields.description: In the activity tab of a Pull Request, the commit hash links that would ordinarily take you to the source commit, instead lead to a 404 as the link is generated for the destination repository.
fields.summary: Pull Request activity tab commit hash links point to destination repository instead of source resulting in a 404 (BB-6362)

fields.description: In the issues, on each entry, the user's name has the space between the name and the text as apart of the link. By hovering this is perceptible.
fields.summary: Link on User's name has a trailing space (BB-6381)

Hi there, I'm getting a 500 error when uploading multiple images to an issue.  It actually does take if you go back to the issue.  It gave me this code in the error:

Steps to repro:  Create issue\\
Fill in fields, browse and upload 1 image\\
Save issue\\
Edit issue\\
upload additional image\\
save

Note, also happens if I am trying to delete an image, I've previously uploaded, then save.

fields.description:
Various pulldown menus/buttons close immediately when clicking on it. For instance the profile menu/button in the top right corner: I click on it, the menu pops up, but as soon as I release the mouse button, the menu gets closed again. This happens on almost any (all?) pulldown menus - at least in the main menu bar.

This happens on Windows 7 64bit with Firefox 16.0.1
fields.summary: Pulldown menus close immediately

fields.description: For teams, the username aliases are likely common for an entire team. There should be a way to manage these at the team level rather than needing to set this on each repository.
fields.summary: Manage username aliases for an entire team (BB-6361)

fields.description: I created a repo and transfered it to a team. The SSH link has the new team username in it, but the HTTPS link still has the old username.

fields.description: The RSS icon to the right of the Recent Activity title seems to only show commit history, and does not show pull request activity for example. Is there an rss feed that will include pull requests, comments, etc?
fields.summary: RSS Feed next to Recent Activity does not appear to show the same information as the activity feed!

fields.description:
Currently, when I go to the dashboard, there is no scroll-bar, and using a mouse's scroll-wheel has no effect.  If there is a long newsfeed, I can see nothing beyond the bottom of the browser window.

This is also the case for issue-pages (more critical, since comments below bottom of screen can't be seen), and repository overview pages (can't see all of the README file for a repo).  Probably other pages are affected as well.

(Using Firefox 16.0.1)
fields.summary: Several web-pages can't be scrolled

fields.description:
Before the upgrade to the newer, sexier BitBucket, when creating a pull request it would select sensible defaults. For example, let's say we have:

MainRepo, with 2 branches: default, stage

then I fork MainRepo as MyMainFork.

I make changes in the default branch of MyMainFork, and push them to my fork on BitBucket.

At that point, I select "Pull Request" to issue one. In the old BitBucket, by default it selected the branch w/ changesets that were ahead of the common ancestor between MainRepo and MyMainFork, and it would choose the destination repository as MainRepo.

In the new BitBucket, it picks the default branch and MyMainFork as the defaults for the Pull Request destination. This doesn't make any sense!! Why would I issue a Pull Request from MyMainFork to MyMainFork?

I've done this by accident twice now, and was left wondering why nobody could see my Pull Request.
fields.summary: Sensible defaults for Pull Request configuration

fields.description:
Samsung Galaxy S2

# start app
# go to page émission 30 vies
# scroll to épi 01
# tap épi 01 pour rentrer dans la page épisode
# executer 10 tap en succession rapide sur la fléche droite (suivant\\
épisode) de manière a ce que la pub catfish n'a pas le temps de s'afficher au complet
# rendus dans la page de l'épisode 10 attendre

Probléme :\\
le catfish fera 9-10 "slide-down".

Comportement recherché:\\
un seul affichage de 10 secondes
fields.summary: Catfish affiché a plusieurs reprises à la transition entre diff pages épisode

fields.description:
Trying to open up a pull request from my dev branch to the qa branch. In the top, it shows me that dev was updated x hours ago and QA was last updated 11 days ago. However, down below it says there are no commits and all of the functionality to submit the pull request is disabled.

See the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Cannot open pull request from one branch to another because it says there aren't any changes when there actually are

fields.description:
Bonjour,

Les calls pub on etait CQisées et les résultats sont dans le fichier excell attaché.

Toutes les valeures en rouge dans le deuxième tableau sont a corriger.\\
Les bonnes valeurs se trouve dans le premier tableau.\\
A la fin du deuxième tableau des colonnes suplémentaires apparaissent.\\
Ce sont des questions supplémentaires remarquées durrant le CQ :

* calls pub manquand complétement
* parametre qui apparrais dans un call ou il n'est pas supposer exister
* parametre qui manque dans un call ou il est supposer exister
* transitions qui ne trigger pas de call
* transitions qui trigger plusieurs calls
* transitions qui trigger des calls dans le mauvais ordre
* situations dans lequelles les calls déclanchées ont un comportement inconsistents (menus genres-> accueil; accueil > menu genres fait desfois 2 calls des fois 3 calls de fois pas du tout)

etc

A la fin du fichier excell j'ai rajouter les régles de transformation pour les caracteres non-pérmis (les caracteres accentuées perdent les accets, les espaces deviene des - etc )

Merci,\\
nick
fields.summary: Les appelles de Pub

fields.description:
Ex1 : Quand on fais "Back" à partir d’une page "Genres" on sort de l’app au lieux de revenir au menu "Genres"

a.     Lancer l’app

b.     Faire un tap sur le menu « Genres »

c.      Faire un tap sur un des genres

d.     Faire un tap sur le bouton « Back » /  « Retour »

Il faut revenir dans le menu « Genres ».\\
À un deuxième tap sur « Back », revenir dans la ppage.\\
À un troisième tap sur « Back », sortir de l’app.

Ex2 : Quand on fais "Back" à partir d’une page "Plus" on sort de l’app au lieux de revenir au menu "Plus"

Il faut revenir dans le menu « Plus ».

À un deuxième tap sur « Back », revenir dans la ppage.

À un troisième tap sur « Back », sortir de l’app.
fields.summary: Back sort de l'app au lieux de revenir au niveau précedent
Linking to non-existant wiki page is broken

fields.description: If the percentage of "bug" issues in BitBucket is relatively low and most of them are, for example, "tasks" it is really inconvenient to always change the kind for each new issue.
fields.summary: Allow to choose default issue kind

fields.description: If there's someone in the team who's responsible for assignment of tasks or it's just one-person project it could be useful to automatically assign all BitBucket issues to that person. This should be optional, of course.
fields.summary: Allow to choose default assignee

fields.description:
If issue ID is mentioned in commit description BitBucket replaces it with link to issue page.

Why don't you automatically add the link back from issue page to commit related to it?
fields.summary: Show commits related to issue along with comments

fields.description:
It would be great if you could support Mozilla's Persona standard for decentralized single sign-on. Implementation is fairly easy:

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Persona/Quick_Setup
fields.summary: Support login with BrowserID/Persona (BB-6380)

fields.description:
Creating new repositories on the API is defaulting to public, which is contrary to the API specification.  Also, I think this has changed, as it used to work just fine.

The only parameters I set are:\\
name="repository-name"\\
scm="git"

URL:\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/

This should default as a private API, and is not.  Also, this is using OAuth.

Thank you!
fields.summary: POST of new repository from API is public by default

fields.description:
Would be really awesome to be able to point users to a url such as

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues/new?assigned=dlo&kind=proposal&priority=low&component=issuetracker
fields.summary: Allow issues variables to be prefilled via URL parameters (BB-6488)
